folder: dale Avenue & Van Nest Avenue, Bronx, NY
original_title: Bronx: Bronxdale Avenue - Van Nest Avenue
text:
Bronxdale Ave. (running from right to left, on which "For Sale" sign appears), south from Van Nest (right) to Pierce Aves., showing a general view, in a westerly direction, of the surrounding area as seen from the lower end of the Morris Park Race Track. On the left are the repair shops and extensive freight yards of the New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad extending west to Unionport Road. In the upper left hand corner, east of the Unionport Road bridge over the tracks, is visible the railroad's Van Nest station.

About 1910.

folder: dale Avenue & Van Nest Avenue, Bronx, NY
original_title: Bronx: Bronxdale Avenue - Van Nest Avenue
text:
Bronxdale Ave. (running from right to left in front of park), south from Van Nest Ave. (right) to Sackett Ave., showing a general view, in a westerly direction, of the surrounding area as seen from the lower end of the Morris Park Race Track. In the center are the repair shops and extensive freight yards of the New York, New Haven and Hartford Railroad, extending west to the Unionport Road bridge over the tracks. Directly east of the bridge is visible the railroad's Van Nest station. The old Morris Park station was located on the empty lot directly in front of the repair shops and to the right of the store house seen under construction. The New Morris Park depot is situated on Sackett Ave., at Paulding Ave.

About 1910.

folder: dale Avenue & Van Nest Avenue, Bronx, NY
original_title: Bronx: Bronxdale Avenue - Van Nest Avenue
text:
Bronxdale Avenue, north from near Van Nest Avenue and showing Parkchester Houses, the Metropolitan Life Insurance Company's housing center on the former site of the Catholic Protectory.

June 22, 1940

P. L. Sperr
